name: Overview
data:
[{"id":"d0bf9a77-8257-4927-96ca-4736f1fcc01f","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Function: getYPOint","styles":{"bold":true}}],"children":[]},{"id":"73012cd0-9aa1-494d-a2a5-fe67435ad502","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Description
","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":"The ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"getYPOint","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" function is a high-level resolution utility used to calculate the "points-to" set for a collection of potential targets at a specific line in the source code. It takes a list of candidate callees—which may be raw namespace strings, ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"Definition","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" objects, or ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"ScopeItem","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" objects—and transforms them into a unified, flat list of resolved, concrete namespaces. This function serves as the primary interface for identifying where data flows during complex operations like variable assignments or function calls.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"530f7297-40bf-44b7-9532-24e59dabdb39","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Why this matters
","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":"Static analysis frequently deals with collections of potential values, especially when resolving right-hand side expressions or function arguments. Since a variable could point to multiple different things (due to conditional branching or dynamic typing), the analyzer needs a robust way to "clean" and "resolve" these lists. ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"getYPOint","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" acts as the standardizer; it ensures that no matter what internal object represents a target, it is converted into a resolved namespace string that other parts of the system can understand and use.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"377d50ef-bc30-4d4e-aa38-3d88a1226be1","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"How it works","styles":{"bold":true}}],"children":[]},{"id":"7f8e5274-d1f2-422f-93a9-72ac2c000b7f","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Input Normalization:","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" It first ensures the input ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"yList","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is a list and then uses ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"flatten","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" to collapse any nested structures. It filters out empty or null values to ensure a clean working set.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"5557c211-5462-47bb-b813-957a89237868","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Closure Setup (","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":"closure","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" / ","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":"func","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":"):","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" It creates a specialized inner function that captures the current analysis context. This internal ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"func","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is designed to:","styles":{}}],"children":[{"id":"ec69d94d-2b41-4cde-8e3e-247c1a168f17","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Detect if a target is a ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"Definition","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" or ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"ScopeItem","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and extract its underlying namespace string (","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"get_ns","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":").","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"12c0f097-5337-45b1-be5d-e1e7a48842de","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Call the ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"resolve","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" method on that namespace to determine its ultimate concrete target at the specified ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"row","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":".","styles":{}}],"children":[]}]},{"id":"b3fb3621-4a9e-4457-8d9d-0d9ce680bd68","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Mapping & Reduction:","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" It applies the resolution function to every item in the list. Finally, it uses ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"reduce","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" to merge all individual resolution results into one large, flat list of reachable namespaces.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"def36c19-622d-46c9-aff5-555dcf30ece3","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Example Scenario
","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":"Consider an assignment ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"x = [a, b]","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" where ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"a","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is a String and ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"b","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is an Integer.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"537e593b-9f5e-4b60-b6ca-f677d192314e","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"getYPOint","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is called with the list ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"[Definition(a), Definition(b)]","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":".","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"5ac59551-50f9-4a6a-b116-252963b28515","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"The ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"closure","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" logic extracts the namespaces ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"module.a","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"module.b","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":".","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"bcf8cf3c-7292-4481-9e4f-e4bdd91d4c5f","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"It calls ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"resolve","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" on both.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"0fd25ef5-4909-48c0-8cc8-c5b94a19604f","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"The final result returned is ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"["<str>", "<int>"]","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":". The analyzer now knows that ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"x","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" points to both a string and an integer type.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"4876382a-74ea-4881-b076-a7489f739c0e","type":"divider","props":{},"children":[]},{"id":"aaa67007-d2b5-4ac5-ad89-f662a80374bb","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":3,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Sub-functions","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"0f6d1fcd-e529-4e2c-b13d-1f2236a23014","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":4,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Function: closure","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"29854841-ada4-46c0-92b9-696d284507a7","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Description:
","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":"Creates and returns a resolver function bound to the current analysis context. This function acts as a factory, producing a specific ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"func","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" instance that can safely resolve various object types into namespaces within the parent's environment.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"466ed764-d93b-43ce-ae15-1c239509ca54","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":4,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Function: func","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"180d3f6c-fa84-41d0-85d9-4fd099f345f1","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Description:
","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":"The core worker for the resolution pass. It normalizes an individual callee by extracting its namespace if it is currently wrapped in a ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"Definition","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" or ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"ScopeItem","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" object, then invokes the main ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"resolve","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" method to find the final target.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"8a0055a7-aa50-48e0-89ae-083bdcea2447","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[],"children":[]}]
